verses.text: How doth the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* \w sit|strong="H3427"\w* \w solitary|strong="H0910"\w*, \add that was\add* \w full|strong="H7227"\w* of \w people|strong="H5971"\w*! \add how\add* is she become as a \w widow|strong="H0490"\w*! she \add that was\add* \w great|strong="H7227"\w* among the \w nations|strong="H1471"\w*, \add and\add* \w princess|strong="H8282"\w* among the \w provinces|strong="H4082"\w*, \add how\add* is she become \w tributary|strong="H4522"\w*!

She \w weepeth|strong="H1058"\w* \w sore|strong="H1058"\w* in the \w night|strong="H3915"\w*, and her \w tears|strong="H1832"\w* \add are\add* on her \w cheeks|strong="H3895"\w*: among all her \w lovers|strong="H0157"\w* she hath none to \w comfort|strong="H5162"\w* \add her:\add* all her \w friends|strong="H7453"\w* have dealt \w treacherously|strong="H0898"\w* with her, they are become her \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*.

\w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* is gone into \w captivity|strong="H1540"\w* because of \w affliction|strong="H6040"\w*, and because of \w great|strong="H7230"\w* \w servitude|strong="H5656"\w*: she \w dwelleth|strong="H3427"\w* among the \w heathen|strong="H1471"\w*, she \w findeth|strong="H4672"\w* no \w rest|strong="H4494"\w*: all her \w persecutors|strong="H7291"\w* \w overtook|strong="H5381"\w* her between the \w straits|strong="H4712"\w*.\f + \fr 1.3 \ft because of great…: Heb. for the greatness of servitude\f*

The \w ways|strong="H1870"\w* of \w Zion|strong="H6726"\w* do \w mourn|strong="H0057"\w*, because none \w come|strong="H0935"\w* to the solemn \w feasts|strong="H4150"\w*: all her \w gates|strong="H8179"\w* are \w desolate|strong="H8074"\w*: her \w priests|strong="H3548"\w* \w sigh|strong="H0584"\w*, her \w virgins|strong="H1330"\w* are \w afflicted|strong="H3013"\w*, and she \add is\add* in \w bitterness|strong="H4843"\w*.

Her \w adversaries|strong="H6862"\w* are the \w chief|strong="H7218"\w*, her \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w* \w prosper|strong="H7951"\w*; for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath \w afflicted|strong="H3013"\w* her for the \w multitude|strong="H7230"\w* of her \w transgressions|strong="H6588"\w*: her \w children|strong="H5768"\w* are \w gone|strong="H1980"\w* into \w captivity|strong="H7628"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w enemy|strong="H6862"\w*.

And from the \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Zion|strong="H6726"\w* all her \w beauty|strong="H1926"\w* is \w departed|strong="H3318"\w*: her \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* are become like \w harts|strong="H0354"\w* \add that\add* \w find|strong="H4672"\w* no \w pasture|strong="H4829"\w*, and they are \w gone|strong="H3212"\w* without \w strength|strong="H3581"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w pursuer|strong="H7291"\w*.

\w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* \w remembered|strong="H2142"\w* in the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of her \w affliction|strong="H6040"\w* and of her \w miseries|strong="H4788"\w* all her pleasant \w things|strong="H4262"\w* that she had in the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of \w old|strong="H6924"\w*, when her \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w fell|strong="H5307"\w* into the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of the \w enemy|strong="H6862"\w*, and none did \w help|strong="H5826"\w* her: the \w adversaries|strong="H6862"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* her, \add and\add* did \w mock|strong="H7832"\w* at her \w sabbaths|strong="H4868"\w*.\f + \fr 1.7 \ft pleasant: or, desirable\f*

\w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* hath \w grievously|strong="H2399"\w* \w sinned|strong="H2398"\w*; therefore she is \w removed|strong="H5206"\w*: all that \w honoured|strong="H3513"\w* her \w despise|strong="H2107"\w* her, because they have \w seen|strong="H7200"\w* her \w nakedness|strong="H6172"\w*: yea, she \w sigheth|strong="H0584"\w*, and \w turneth|strong="H7725"\w* \w backward|strong="H0268"\w*.\f + \fr 1.8 \ft is…: Heb. is become a removing, or, wandering\f*

Her \w filthiness|strong="H2932"\w* \add is\add* in her \w skirts|strong="H7757"\w*; she \w remembereth|strong="H2142"\w* not her last \w end|strong="H0319"\w*; therefore she came \w down|strong="H3381"\w* \w wonderfully|strong="H6382"\w*: she had no \w comforter|strong="H5162"\w*. O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \w behold|strong="H7200"\w* my \w affliction|strong="H6040"\w*: for the \w enemy|strong="H0341"\w* hath \w magnified|strong="H1431"\w* \add himself\add*.

The \w adversary|strong="H6862"\w* hath spread \w out|strong="H6566"\w* his \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* upon all her pleasant \w things|strong="H4261"\w*: for she hath \w seen|strong="H7200"\w* \add that\add* the \w heathen|strong="H1471"\w* \w entered|strong="H0935"\w* into her \w sanctuary|strong="H4720"\w*, whom thou didst \w command|strong="H6680"\w* \add that\add* they should not \w enter|strong="H0935"\w* into thy \w congregation|strong="H6951"\w*.\f + \fr 1.10 \ft pleasant: or, desirable\f*

All her \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w sigh|strong="H0584"\w*, they \w seek|strong="H1245"\w* \w bread|strong="H3899"\w*; they have \w given|strong="H5414"\w* their pleasant \w things|strong="H4261"\w* for \w meat|strong="H0400"\w* to \w relieve|strong="H7725"\w* the \w soul|strong="H5315"\w*: \w see|strong="H7200"\w*, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and \w consider|strong="H5027"\w*; for I am become \w vile|strong="H2151"\w*.\f + \fr 1.11 \ft to…: or, to make the soul to come again\f*

¶ \add Is it\add* nothing to you, all ye that \w pass|strong="H5674"\w* \w by|strong="H1870"\w*? \w behold|strong="H5027"\w*, and \w see|strong="H7200"\w* if there \w be|strong="H3426"\w* any \w sorrow|strong="H4341"\w* like unto my \w sorrow|strong="H4341"\w*, which is \w done|strong="H5953"\w* unto me, wherewith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath \w afflicted|strong="H3013"\w* \add me\add* in the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* of his \w fierce|strong="H2740"\w* \w anger|strong="H0639"\w*.\f + \fr 1.12 \ft Is it…: or, It is nothing\f*\f + \fr 1.12 \ft pass by: Heb. pass by the way?\f*

From \w above|strong="H4791"\w* hath he \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w fire|strong="H0784"\w* into my \w bones|strong="H6106"\w*, and it \w prevaileth|strong="H7287"\w* against them: he hath \w spread|strong="H6566"\w* a \w net|strong="H7568"\w* for my \w feet|strong="H7272"\w*, he hath \w turned|strong="H7725"\w* me \w back|strong="H0268"\w*: he hath \w made|strong="H5414"\w* me \w desolate|strong="H8074"\w* \add and\add* \w faint|strong="H1739"\w* all the \w day|strong="H3117"\w*.

The \w yoke|strong="H5923"\w* of my \w transgressions|strong="H6588"\w* is \w bound|strong="H8244"\w* by his \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*: they are \w wreathed|strong="H8276"\w*, \add and\add* come \w up|strong="H5927"\w* upon my \w neck|strong="H6677"\w*: he hath made my \w strength|strong="H3581"\w* to \w fall|strong="H3782"\w*, the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* hath \w delivered|strong="H5414"\w* me into \add their\add* \w hands|strong="H3027"\w*, \add from whom\add* I am not \w able|strong="H3201"\w* to rise \w up|strong="H6965"\w*.

The \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* hath trodden under \w foot|strong="H5541"\w* all my \w mighty|strong="H0047"\w* \add men\add* in the \w midst|strong="H7130"\w* of me: he hath \w called|strong="H7121"\w* an \w assembly|strong="H4150"\w* against me to \w crush|strong="H7665"\w* my young \w men|strong="H0970"\w*: the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* hath \w trodden|strong="H1869"\w* the \w virgin|strong="H1330"\w*, the \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, \add as\add* in a \w winepress|strong="H1660"\w*.\f + \fr 1.15 \ft the virgin…: or, the winepress of the virgin, etc\f*

For these \add things\add* I \w weep|strong="H1058"\w*; mine \w eye|strong="H5869"\w*, mine \w eye|strong="H5869"\w* runneth \w down|strong="H3381"\w* with \w water|strong="H4325"\w*, because the \w comforter|strong="H5162"\w* that should \w relieve|strong="H7725"\w* my \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* is \w far|strong="H7368"\w* from me: my \w children|strong="H1121"\w* are \w desolate|strong="H8074"\w*, because the \w enemy|strong="H0341"\w* \w prevailed|strong="H1396"\w*.\f + \fr 1.16 \ft relieve: Heb. bring back\f*

\w Zion|strong="H6726"\w* spreadeth \w forth|strong="H6566"\w* her \w hands|strong="H3027"\w*, \add and there is\add* none to \w comfort|strong="H5162"\w* her: the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath \w commanded|strong="H6680"\w* concerning \w Jacob|strong="H3290"\w*, \add that\add* his \w adversaries|strong="H6862"\w* \add should be\add* round \w about|strong="H5439"\w* him: \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* is as a menstruous \w woman|strong="H5079"\w* among them.

¶ The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* is \w righteous|strong="H6662"\w*; for I have \w rebelled|strong="H4784"\w* against his \w commandment|strong="H6310"\w*: \w hear|strong="H8085"\w*, I pray you, all \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, and \w behold|strong="H7200"\w* my \w sorrow|strong="H4341"\w*: my \w virgins|strong="H1330"\w* and my young \w men|strong="H0970"\w* are \w gone|strong="H1980"\w* into \w captivity|strong="H7628"\w*.\f + \fr 1.18 \ft commandment: Heb. mouth\f*

I \w called|strong="H7121"\w* for my \w lovers|strong="H0157"\w*, \add but\add* they \w deceived|strong="H7411"\w* me: my \w priests|strong="H3548"\w* and mine \w elders|strong="H2205"\w* gave up the \w ghost|strong="H1478"\w* in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, while they \w sought|strong="H1245"\w* their \w meat|strong="H0400"\w* to \w relieve|strong="H7725"\w* their \w souls|strong="H5315"\w*.

\w Behold|strong="H7200"\w*, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; for I \add am\add* in \w distress|strong="H6887"\w*: my \w bowels|strong="H4578"\w* are \w troubled|strong="H2560"\w*; mine \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* is \w turned|strong="H2015"\w* \w within|strong="H7130"\w* me; for I have \w grievously|strong="H4784"\w* \w rebelled|strong="H4784"\w*: \w abroad|strong="H2351"\w* the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w* \w bereaveth|strong="H7921"\w*, at \w home|strong="H1004"\w* \add there is\add* as \w death|strong="H4194"\w*.

They have \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* that I \w sigh|strong="H0584"\w*: \add there is\add* none to \w comfort|strong="H5162"\w* me: all mine \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w* have \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* of my \w trouble|strong="H7451"\w*; they are \w glad|strong="H7797"\w* that thou hast \w done|strong="H6213"\w* \add it:\add* thou wilt \w bring|strong="H0935"\w* the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* \add that\add* thou hast \w called|strong="H7121"\w*, and they shall be \w like|strong="H3644"\w* unto me.\f + \fr 1.21 \ft called: or, proclaimed\f*

Let all their \w wickedness|strong="H7451"\w* \w come|strong="H0935"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* thee; and \w do|strong="H5953"\w* unto them, as thou hast \w done|strong="H5953"\w* unto me for all my \w transgressions|strong="H6588"\w*: for my \w sighs|strong="H0585"\w* \add are\add* \w many|strong="H7227"\w*, and my \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* \add is\add* \w faint|strong="H1742"\w*.
